channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Incredibly dangerous potholes, 1st March
item.description:
These repairs have been outstanding for far too long. Cycling along this road in early mor I g / night is very dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 196, St John's Way, Archway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cleaning and blocked gully, 1st March
item.description:
Mallard Path has not been swept for months and needs a blitz. I would also like to know when it is on the schedule to be regularly cleaned. The drain in the underpass is blocked. Each time it rains it floods. I would like an update on what is being done about the blocked drain. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tom Cribb Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole by new flat development, 1st March
item.description:
There is a pothole which poses a risk as it's quite deep. Risk to everyone especially cyclists and pedestrians. Please could you fix this. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodside Grange Road, Woodside Park, Greater London

item.title: Road too narrow for 4 way traffic lights, 1st March
item.description:
The traffic lights at the top of Roseberry Ave. Operate on a 4 way system. Cars can turn right while cars turning left are held on red. However, the road is too narrow for cars or buses to turn right, with stationary cars in the left lane. This leads to tail backs, with drivers leaning on their horns at all hours of day and night. Last night a driver was honking their horn at 4am waking me and many other residents on Spa Green Estate. The solution? Change the lights so that it’s green for all traffic on Roseberry Avenue, rather than filtering the traffic by lane. The only alternative is to widen the road by about 100cm. I’m guessing the lights are the cheaper option.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Rosebery Avenue, Clerkenwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More spillage of rubbish, 1st March
item.description:
I reported more flytipping yesterday. I later saw someone banging up the spilled rubbish into grey bags and these were left by the bin. These bags have been damaged overnight and more rubbish is strewn around the bin and onto the road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pier Way, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole Horsfeld Road, 1st March
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Horsfeld Road, Eltham
